Stem: Branched at base making several upright woody stems.
Leaves: Divided into 3 or sometimes 5 or 7 segments, 2-8 cm long, very variable in shape, on bristly stalks.
Flowers: Cream, yellow or pinkish with 5 petals. Reddish or purplish centre. Solitary in the leaf stalk joins, on bristly stalks.
FruitSeeds: Oval to spherical with bristles. Drying out with age and splitting to release numerous seeds.
Habitat: Croplands, wasteland, disturbed areas, old gardens.
DistinguishingFeatures: Generally shorter and less erect than other Hibiscuses (*Hibiscus* species).
